title: Pada Yatra pilgrimage through Kumana National Park concludes
byline: Pada Yatra journey on foot to attend Kataragama Maha Devala festival ended yesterday with the closureof the main entrance in Kumana National Park.

title: Admission to Grade 1 in 2026: Education Ministry issues official circular
byline: The Education Ministry  has issued the official circular regarding the admission of children to Grade 1 in government schools for the year 2026.

title: Govt. will implement IMF proposals to the letter despite any public protest, political pressure: Lalkantha
byline: Minister of Agriculture, Land, Irrigation and Livestock Development K.D. Lalkantha asserted that the government would comply with the IMF programme regardless of public protests.

title: Granting ad hoc, non-transparent and large tax exemptions has created significant issues for Govt.: IMF
byline: Granting ad hoc, non-transparent and large tax exemptions in the past has created significant issues, obviously on the fiscal space and revenue - not only in terms of losses in foregone revenue for the government but rise in corruption vulnerability, according to Evan Papageorgiou, IMF Mission Chief for Sri Lanka.

title: At least 13 killed and 20 children missing in Texas floods
byline: Thirteen people have died in Kerr County in the US state of Texas, according to authorities, after severe weather and flooding hit parts of the state.

title: UNDP warns household debt crisis worsening
byline: The United Nations Development Programme (UNDP) warned that Sri Lanka’s household debt crisis has likely intensified since last measured in 2023, as it threw its weight behind a major new financial literacy drive with the Central Bank.

title: Sri Lanka to showcase organic products at BioFach 2026 in Germany
byline: Sri Lanka Export Development Board (EDB) of the Industry and Entrepreneurship Development Ministry has announced its participation in the most renowned organic trade fair worldwide, BioFach 2026.

title: Tea Auction sees stronger demand for better grades
byline: The auction offerings totalled 6.4 million kilogrammes (M/Kgs), marginally lower to the 6.5 M/Kgs on offer the previous week.

title: Rubber export revenues slide in May on weak sheet rubber demand
byline: Sri Lanka’s export earnings from rubber and rubber-finished products fell 9.33 percent year-on-year to US $ 73.60 million in May, as sheet rubber exports slumped 40.91 percent, indicating the persistent pressure on the key product categories in international markets, commodity broker Forbes and Walker said in its June rubber market report.

title: Over 300 arrested in overnight operation across Gampaha towns
byline: More than 300 individuals were arrested during a large-scale joint operation conducted overnight on July 4 in the areas of Kandana, Ja-Ela, Wattala and Ragama.

title: Avoid trips to Meemure until further notice
byline: Vehicular traffic on the Hunnasgiriya-Meemure road has been temporarily suspended due to an emergency situation reported during the renovation work of the Kaikawala bridge.

title: LPBOA slams bus fare revision as misleading and ineffective
byline: The Lanka Private Bus Owners’ Association (LPBOA) has strongly criticized the government’s recent bus fare revision, calling it both misleading and meaningless.

title: Texas floods update: At least 24 dead, up to 25 children reported missing
byline: At least 24 people have died, and up to 25 people at a girls’ camp remained missing, as flash floods hit the US state of Texas on Friday, according to officials.
